A line from (0.75, 0) to (0.75, 0.75) 3. A line from (0.75, 0.75) to (0, 0.75) 4. A line from (0, 0.75) to (0, 0.375) Close the loop. The loop must be closed; it cannot contain any open curves or gaps. 3D Sketch Scale the 2D sketch by 0.75 in all directions. Translate the scaled 2D sketch by (0, 0, 0) and apply a zero-degree rotation along all axes (Euler Angles: 0, 0, 0). Extrusion Extrude the sketch by 0.1875 units in the z-direction (towards the normal). Part 2 Construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. Set the new coordinate system at (0, 0.375, 0.1875) with no rotations (Euler Angles: 0, 0, 0). 2D Sketch Create a new sketch on the X-Y plane. * Draw four lines: 1. A line from (0, 0) to (0.375, 0) 2. A line from (0.375, 0) to (0.375, 0.375) 3. A line from (0.375, 0.375) to (0, 0.375) 4. A line from (0, 0.375) to (0, 0) Close the loop. The loop must be closed; it cannot contain any open curves or gaps. 3D Sketch Scale the 2D sketch by 0.375 in all directions. Translate the scaled 2D sketch by (0, 0.375, 0.1875) and apply a zero-degree rotation along all axes (Euler Angles: 0, 0, 0). Extrusion Extrude the sketch by 0.375 units in the z-direction (towards the normal). Final Shape Create the final 3D model of a rectangular prism with a triangular cutout on one of its faces by applying the "JoinFeatureOperation" to combine Part 1 and Part 2. The height, width, and length of the final shape are provided by the "description" key in the CAD Assembly JSON for that element.</description>
